trans-unit.source: Consists of a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> objects to be used with catalogs of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> class is created by the various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls in their implementations of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart.GetAvailableWebPartDescriptions%2A> method.

For each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control that is contained in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> control, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object is created.
This object maintains basic information about a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control, including its ID, its title, its description, and a path to an associated icon.

The various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls can use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object to display a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control's information in the catalog, without having to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control itself.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> class is used internally by the Web Parts control set to maintain a collection of all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects used in a catalog.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection is used only when a page is in catalog display mode.

When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> control is being rendered, it loops through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection, adding the information from each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object to the displayed catalog.
Initializes an empty new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection"></xref> class.
This overload of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor can be used to create an empty collection.

For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ImportCatalogPart> control creates an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> object if the content of an imported description file is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection"></xref> object by passing in an <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29> constructor is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart.GetAvailableWebPartDescriptions%2A> method implementations within the various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls to create a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects.

A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> objects that correspond to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart"></xref> controls in a catalog.
webPartDescriptions is `null`.
A member of webPartDescriptions is `null`
-or-
A member of webPartDescriptions is not an object of type
-or-
A member of webPartDescriptions has a duplicate property
Returns a value indicating whether a particular control exists in the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object is part of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection.
A particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref>.

A Boolean value that indicates whether a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> exists in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection"></xref>.
Copies the collection to an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to assemble a custom array that can contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> objects to contain the copied collection.
The starting point in the array at which to place the collection contents.
Returns the position of a particular member of the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.IndexOf%2A> method is useful if you have multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects, and you need to know the ordinal position of one object relative to the others.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> that is a member of the collection.
An integer that indicates the position of a particular object in the collection.
Gets a member of the collection based on its index within the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.Item%2A> indexer allows you to access the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection by index.
The index of a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> in a collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Gets a member of the collection based on a unique string identifier.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.Item%2A> indexer enables you to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection according to a unique identifier.
The string that serves as a unique identifier for a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription"></xref> in a collection.
The first in the collection whose ID equals the value of id.
